title: 110_s454
content: The Act may be cited as the "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" and includes an increase in Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants, with changes including raising the grant amount to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008. Additional funds are authorized and appropriated for this purpose. $4,331,000,000 is appropriated for the academic year 2007-2008 to increase the maximum Federal Pell Grant by $1,050. The maximum Federal Pell Grant for award year 2007-2008 is increased by $1,050, effective July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on Education Loan Interest Deduction: The maximum deduction for the taxable year is now $3,750, with an increase in the phaseout to $75,000 ($150,000). Conforming amendments have been made to the Internal Revenue Code. The phaseout for the education loan interest deduction has been increased to $75,000 ($150,000) in the Internal Revenue Code. This change will apply to taxable years beginning after 2007. The amendments made by this section increase certain dollar amounts based on the cost-of-living adjustment for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006. This also repeals the sunset provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. The sunset provisions of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 do not apply to certain sections, including the elimination of the 60-month limit and increase in income limitation on student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date of amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. The sunset provision of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to modifications to education individual retirement accounts. SEC. 5. Repeal of EGTRRA sunset for employer-provided educational assistance. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 will not apply to the extension of exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance.
